Model Package (admet.model)Â¶

The admet.model package provides model implementations for ADMET property prediction. It currently supports two main model families:

  • Chemprop Models (admet.model.chemprop): Message-passing neural networks using the Chemprop library with PyTorch Lightning integration.

  • Classical Models (admet.model.classical): Traditional machine learning models like XGBoost and LightGBM.

class admet.model.BaseDataConfig(data_dir='???', test_file=None, blind_file=None, smiles_col='SMILES', target_cols=<factory>, target_weights=<factory>, output_dir=None)[source]

Bases: object

Base configuration for data paths and columns.

Shared across all model types. Model-specific data configs can inherit and extend this class.

Parameters:

data_dir: Directory containing train.csv and validation.csv files. test_file: Path to test data CSV file. blind_file: Path to blind test data CSV file (no labels). smiles_col: Column name containing SMILES strings. target_cols: List of target column names for multi-task prediction. target_weights: Per-task weights for the loss function. output_dir: Directory to save model checkpoints and outputs.

Parameters:

  • data_dir (str)

  • test_file (str | None)

  • blind_file (str | None)

  • smiles_col (str)

  • target_cols (list[str])

  • target_weights (list[float])

  • output_dir (str | None)

blind_file: str | None = None
data_dir: str = '???'
output_dir: str | None = None
smiles_col: str = 'SMILES'
target_cols: list[str]
target_weights: list[float]
test_file: str | None = None
class admet.model.BaseMlflowConfig(enabled=True, tracking_uri=None, experiment_name='admet', run_name=None, run_id=None, parent_run_id=None, nested=False, log_model=True)[source]

Bases: object

Base configuration for MLflow experiment tracking.

Shared across all model types to ensure consistent tracking behavior.

Parameters:

enabled: Whether to enable MLflow tracking. tracking_uri: MLflow tracking server URI. experiment_name: MLflow experiment name. run_name: Optional run name for the MLflow run. run_id: Existing MLflow run ID to attach to. parent_run_id: Parent run ID for nested runs (ensemble). nested: Whether to create a nested run. log_model: Whether to log the trained model as artifact.

Parameters:

  • enabled (bool)

  • tracking_uri (str | None)

  • experiment_name (str)

  • run_name (str | None)

  • run_id (str | None)

  • parent_run_id (str | None)

  • nested (bool)

  • log_model (bool)

enabled: bool = True
experiment_name: str = 'admet'
log_model: bool = True
nested: bool = False

run_id: str | None = None

tracking_uri: str | None = None
class admet.model.BaseModel(config)[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for all ADMET models.

All model implementations (chemprop, chemeleon, xgboost, lightgbm, catboost) must inherit from this class and implement the required abstract methods.

Attributes:

model_type: Class attribute identifying the model type (set by registry). config: The OmegaConf configuration for this model.

Example:
>>> from admet.model.registry import ModelRegistry
>>> @ModelRegistry.register("my_model")
... class MyModel(BaseModel):
...     def fit(self, smiles, y, val_smiles=None, val_y=None):
...         # Training implementation
...         self._fitted = True
...         return self
...     def predict(self, smiles):
...         # Prediction implementation
...         return np.zeros(len(smiles))
...     @classmethod
...     def from_config(cls, config):
...         return cls(config)
Parameters:

config (DictConfig)

abstract fit(smiles, y, val_smiles=None, val_y=None)[source]

Train the model on the provided data.

Return type:

BaseModel

Parameters:

  • y (ndarray)

  • val_smiles (list[str] | None)

  • val_y (ndarray | None)

Parameters:

smiles: List of SMILES strings for training. y: Target values as numpy array. val_smiles: Optional validation SMILES strings. val_y: Optional validation target values.

Returns:

Self for method chaining.

Raises:

ValueError: If input data is invalid.

abstract classmethod from_config(config)[source]

Create a model instance from OmegaConf configuration.

This factory method extracts model-specific parameters from the unified config structure and instantiates the appropriate model.

Return type:

TypeVar(T, bound= BaseModel)

Parameters:

config (DictConfig)

Parameters:

config: Full configuration with nested model parameters.

Returns:

Configured model instance.

Example:
>>> config = OmegaConf.load("config.yaml")
>>> model = ChempropModel.from_config(config)

class admet.model.BaseModelConfig(type='???', data=<factory>, mlflow=<factory>)[source]

Bases: object

Base configuration inherited by all model-specific configs.

This class defines the common structure for model configurations. The actual model parameters are nested under a model-type-specific section (e.g., config.model.chemprop, config.model.xgboost).

Parameters:

type: Model type discriminator (âchempropâ, âxgboostâ, etc.). data: Data configuration section. mlflow: MLflow tracking configuration.

Parameters:

  • type (str)

  • data (BaseDataConfig)

  • mlflow (BaseMlflowConfig)

data: BaseDataConfig
mlflow: BaseMlflowConfig
type: str = '???'

class admet.model.Ensemble(config)[source]

Bases: MLflowMixin

Generic ensemble of ADMET models.

Creates and manages an ensemble of models of any registered type. Supports training across multiple data splits/folds with aggregated predictions and uncertainty estimation.

Parameters:

config (DictConfig) â Ensemble configuration with model, data, and mlflow settings.

models

List of fitted model instances.

Type:

list[BaseModel]

model_type

Type of model in the ensemble.

Type:

str

Examples

>>> config = OmegaConf.create({
...     "model": {"type": "xgboost", "xgboost": {"n_estimators": 100}},
...     "ensemble": {"n_models": 5},
...     "data": {"smiles_col": "smiles", "target_cols": ["target"]},
...     "mlflow": {"enabled": False},
... })
>>> ensemble = Ensemble(config)
>>> ensemble.fit(smiles_list, targets_array)
>>> mean_preds, std_preds = ensemble.predict_with_uncertainty(test_smiles)
fit(smiles, targets, *, sample_weight=None, seeds=None, **kwargs)[source]

Fit ensemble of models.

Parameters:

  • smiles (list[str]) â List of SMILES strings.

  • targets (np.ndarray) â Target values.

  • sample_weight (np.ndarray | None) â Optional sample weights.

  • seeds (list[int] | None) â Random seeds for each model (default: 0, 1, â¦, n_models-1).

  • **kwargs (Any) â Additional keyword arguments passed to model.fit().

Returns:

Fitted ensemble instance.

Ensemble

class admet.model.FingerprintConfig(type='morgan', morgan=<factory>, rdkit=<factory>, maccs=<factory>, mordred=<factory>)[source]

Bases: object

Configuration for molecular fingerprint/descriptor generation.

Used by classical models (XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost) that require fixed-length feature vectors instead of molecular graphs.

Parameters:

type: Fingerprint type to use (âmorganâ, ârdkitâ, âmaccsâ, âmordredâ). morgan: Morgan fingerprint settings. rdkit: RDKit fingerprint settings. maccs: MACCS keys settings. mordred: Mordred descriptor settings.

Parameters:

  • type (str)

  • morgan (MorganFingerprintConfig)

  • rdkit (RDKitFingerprintConfig)

  • maccs (MACCSConfig)

  • mordred (MordredConfig)

maccs: MACCSConfig
mordred: MordredConfig
morgan: MorganFingerprintConfig
rdkit: RDKitFingerprintConfig
type: str = 'morgan'

class admet.model.MLflowMixin[source]

Bases: object

Mixin providing consistent MLflow tracking across all model types.

This mixin extracts common MLflow tracking logic to ensure all models (chemprop, chemeleon, xgboost, etc.) have consistent logging behavior.

Attributes:

config: Expected from the model class (DictConfig). _mlflow_run_id: ID of the active MLflow run. _mlflow_client: MLflow tracking client instance.

Example:
>>> class MyModel(BaseModel, MLflowMixin):
...     def fit(self, smiles, y, val_smiles=None, val_y=None):
...         self.init_mlflow(run_name="my_run")
...         self.log_params_from_config()
...         # Training loop
...         self.log_metrics({"train_loss": 0.1})
...         self.end_mlflow()
...         return self
config: DictConfig
end_mlflow(status='FINISHED')[source]

class admet.model.ModelRegistry[source]

Bases: object

Registry for model types with factory pattern.

Provides decorator-based registration and factory methods for creating model instances from configuration.

Example:
>>> from admet.model.registry import ModelRegistry
>>> from admet.model.base import BaseModel
>>>
>>> @ModelRegistry.register("my_model")
... class MyModel(BaseModel):
...     # Implementation
...     pass
>>>
>>> # Later, create model from config
>>> config = OmegaConf.create({"model": {"type": "my_model"}})
>>> model = ModelRegistry.create(config)
classmethod clear()[source]

Clear all registered models (primarily for testing).

Return type:

None

classmethod create(config)[source]

Create model instance from configuration.

Looks up the model type from config.model.type and instantiates the corresponding registered model class.

Return type:

BaseModel

Parameters:

config (DictConfig)

Parameters:

config: OmegaConf configuration with model.type field.

Returns:

Instantiated model of the appropriate type.

Raises:

ValueError: If model type is unknown or not registered. KeyError: If config.model.type is missing.

Example:
>>> config = OmegaConf.create({
...     "model": {"type": "chemprop", "chemprop": {...}}
... })
>>> model = ModelRegistry.create(config)

class admet.model.UnfreezeScheduleConfig(freeze_encoder=True, unfreeze_encoder_epoch=None, unfreeze_at_epoch=None, unfreeze_encoder_lr_multiplier=0.1, freeze_decoder_initially=False, unfreeze_decoder_epoch=None)[source]

Bases: object

Configuration for gradual unfreezing of encoder/decoder.

Supports scheduled unfreezing where the encoder (message passing) starts frozen and is optionally unfrozen at a specified epoch.

Parameters:

freeze_encoder: Whether to freeze the encoder initially. unfreeze_encoder_epoch: Epoch at which to unfreeze encoder. unfreeze_at_epoch: Alias for unfreeze_encoder_epoch (YAML compatibility). unfreeze_encoder_lr_multiplier: LR multiplier for unfrozen encoder. freeze_decoder_initially: Whether to freeze decoder initially. unfreeze_decoder_epoch: Epoch at which to unfreeze decoder.

Parameters:

  • freeze_encoder (bool)

  • unfreeze_encoder_epoch (int | None)

  • unfreeze_at_epoch (int | None)

  • unfreeze_encoder_lr_multiplier (float)

  • freeze_decoder_initially (bool)

  • unfreeze_decoder_epoch (int | None)

freeze_decoder_initially: bool = False
freeze_encoder: bool = True
unfreeze_at_epoch: Optional[int] = None
unfreeze_decoder_epoch: Optional[int] = None
unfreeze_encoder_epoch: Optional[int] = None
unfreeze_encoder_lr_multiplier: float = 0.1

reg_lambda: float = 1.0
subsample: float = 0.8

Chemprop SubpackageÂ¶

The admet.model.chemprop subpackage provides a comprehensive toolkit for training Chemprop MPNN models with advanced features including:

  • Configuration Management: OmegaConf-based configuration for reproducible experiments

  • Ensemble Training: Train multiple models across splits/folds with Ray parallelization

  • Hyperparameter Optimization: Ray Tune integration with ASHA scheduler

  • Curriculum Learning: Quality-aware training with adaptive data weighting

  • Custom FFN Architectures: Mixture of Experts and Branched FFN options

  • MLflow Integration: Full experiment tracking with nested runs

Key ClassesÂ¶

class admet.model.chemprop.ChempropModel(df_train, df_validation=None, df_test=None, smiles_col='smiles', target_cols=[], target_weights=[], output_dir=None, progress_bar=False, hyperparams=None, mlflow_tracking=True, mlflow_tracking_uri=None, mlflow_experiment_name='chemprop', mlflow_run_name=None, mlflow_run_id=None, mlflow_parent_run_id=None, mlflow_nested=False, curriculum_config=None, curriculum_state=None, joint_sampling_config=None, task_affinity_config=None, inter_task_affinity_config=None, data_dir=None)[source]Â¶

Bases: object

High-level wrapper for Chemprop MPNN training and inference.

This class handles the full workflow of preparing data, building the model, training with PyTorch Lightning, and generating predictions. It supports multiple FFN architectures and automatic target normalization.

Parameters:

  • df_train (pandas.DataFrame) â Training dataframe containing SMILES and target columns.

  • df_validation (pandas.DataFrame or None, optional) â Validation dataframe for early stopping and model selection.

  • df_test (pandas.DataFrame or None, optional) â Test dataframe (not used during training).

  • smiles_col (str, default='smiles') â Column name containing SMILES strings.

  • target_cols (list[str], default=[]) â List of target column names for multi-task prediction.

  • target_weights (list[float], default=[]) â Per-task weights for the loss function. If empty, all tasks are weighted equally.

  • output_dir (pathlib.Path or None, optional) â Directory to save model checkpoints.

  • progress_bar (bool, default=False) â Whether to show training progress bar.

  • hyperparams (ChempropHyperparams or None, optional) â Model hyperparameters. If None, defaults are used.

  • mlflow_tracking (bool, default=True) â Whether to enable MLflow tracking for params, metrics, and artifacts.

  • mlflow_experiment_name (str, default='chemprop') â MLflow experiment name to log runs under.

  • mlflow_run_name (str or None, optional) â Optional run name for the MLflow run.

  • mlflow_tracking_uri (Optional[str])

  • mlflow_run_id (Optional[str])

  • mlflow_parent_run_id (Optional[str])

  • mlflow_nested (bool)

  • curriculum_config (CurriculumConfig | None)

  • curriculum_state (CurriculumState | None)

  • joint_sampling_config (JointSamplingConfig | None)

  • task_affinity_config (TaskAffinityConfig | None)

  • inter_task_affinity_config (InterTaskAffinityConfig | None)

  • data_dir (Optional[str])

...     df_train=train_df,
...     df_validation=val_df,
...     smiles_col="smiles",
...     target_cols=["logD", "solubility"],
...     mlflow_tracking=True,
...     mlflow_experiment_name="admet_chemprop",
... )
>>> model.fit()
>>> predictions = model.predict(test_df)
close()[source]Â¶

Close the MLflow run and clean up resources.

This should be called when youâre done with the model to properly end the MLflow run. If not called explicitly, the run will remain active until the process exits.

Return type:

None

fit()[source]Â¶

Train the MPNN model.

Runs training using the PyTorch Lightning trainer with the configured train and validation dataloaders. Handles keyboard interrupts gracefully, allowing the model to be used for prediction even if training is interrupted.

When task affinity is enabled, computes task affinity matrix before model preparation to determine task groupings for multi-head architectures.

When MLflow tracking is enabled, logs hyperparameters at the start of training, and logs metrics, artifacts, and registers the model upon completion.

Returns:

True if training completed normally, False if interrupted.

Return type:

bool

classmethod from_config(config, df_train=None, df_validation=None, df_test=None, df_blind=None)[source]Â¶

Create a ChempropModel from an OmegaConf configuration.

This factory method allows creating a model from a YAML configuration file, enabling reproducible and configurable experiments.

Parameters:

  • config (ChempropConfig or DictConfig) â Configuration object containing data, model, optimization, and MLflow settings. Can be created from a YAML file using OmegaConf.load() and OmegaConf.merge().

  • df_train (pandas.DataFrame, optional) â Pre-loaded training dataframe. If None, will be loaded from config.data.train_file.

  • df_validation (pandas.DataFrame, optional) â Pre-loaded validation dataframe. If None and config.data.validation_file is set, will be loaded from file.

  • df_test (pandas.DataFrame, optional) â Pre-loaded test dataframe. If None and config.data.test_file is set, will be loaded from file.

  • df_blind (pandas.DataFrame, optional) â Pre-loaded blind test dataframe. Stored as an attribute but not used during training.

Returns:

Initialized model ready for training.

Return type:

ChempropModel

Examples

>>> from omegaconf import OmegaConf
>>> config = OmegaConf.merge(
...     OmegaConf.structured(ChempropConfig),
...     OmegaConf.load("experiment.yaml")
... )
>>> model = ChempropModel.from_config(config)
>>> model.fit()

  • split_name (str, default='test') â Split name for labeling plots when generate_plots is True.

class admet.model.chemprop.ModelEnsemble(config)[source]Â¶

Bases: object

Ensemble trainer for multi-model support across multiple splits and folds.

This class orchestrates training of multiple models (chemprop, xgboost, lightgbm, catboost, chemeleon) using Ray for parallelization and MLflow for experiment tracking with nested runs.

Parameters:

config (EnsembleConfig or DictConfig) â Configuration object containing data paths, model architecture, optimization settings, and MLflow configuration. The model type is determined by config.model.type.

class admet.model.chemprop.ChempropHPO(config)[source]Â¶

Bases: object

Orchestrator for Chemprop hyperparameter optimization.

This class manages the full HPO workflow: 1. Builds Ray Tune search space from configuration 2. Runs HPO trials with ASHA early stopping 3. Logs results to MLflow 4. Saves top-k configurations for downstream ensemble training

Attributes:

config: HPO configuration results: Ray Tune results after running HPO

Parameters:

config (HPOConfig)

get_top_k_configs()[source]Â¶

Get the top-k configurations from HPO results.

Return type:

list[dict[str, Any]]

Returns:

List of top-k configuration dictionaries with hyperparameters. Each config includes â_rankâ and â_metric_valueâ metadata.

run()[source]Â¶

Run hyperparameter optimization.

Executes Ray Tune HPO with ASHA scheduler, logs results to MLflow, and returns the result grid.

Return type:

ResultGrid

Returns:

Ray Tune ResultGrid containing all trial results

Configuration ClassesÂ¶

class admet.model.chemprop.ChempropConfig(data=<factory>, model=<factory>, optimization=<factory>, mlflow=<factory>, joint_sampling=<factory>, task_affinity=<factory>, inter_task_affinity=<factory>)[source]Â¶

Bases: object

Complete configuration for a Chemprop training run.

This configuration can be loaded from a YAML file using OmegaConf and passed to ChempropModel.from_config() to create a fully configured model.

Parameters:

  • data (DataConfig) â Data paths and column configuration.

  • model (ModelConfig) â Model architecture configuration.

  • optimization (OptimizationConfig) â Training optimization configuration.

  • mlflow (MlflowConfig) â MLflow tracking configuration.

  • joint_sampling (JointSamplingConfig) â Unified configuration for task-aware oversampling and curriculum learning.

  • task_affinity (TaskAffinityConfig) â Task affinity grouping configuration for multi-task learning.

  • inter_task_affinity (InterTaskAffinityConfig) â Inter-task affinity computation during training (TAG paper lookahead).

Examples

>>> from omegaconf import OmegaConf
>>> from admet.model.chemprop.config import ChempropConfig
>>>
>>> # Load from YAML
>>> config = OmegaConf.merge(
...     OmegaConf.structured(ChempropConfig),
...     OmegaConf.load("config.yaml")
... )
>>>
>>> # Or create programmatically
>>> config = ChempropConfig(
...     data=DataConfig(
...         train_file="train.csv",
...         target_cols=["LogD", "Log KSOL"],
...     ),
...     model=ModelConfig(depth=4, hidden_dim=512),
...     optimization=OptimizationConfig(max_epochs=100),
...     mlflow=MlflowConfig(experiment_name="my_experiment"),
...     joint_sampling=JointSamplingConfig(
...         enabled=True,
...         task_oversampling=TaskOversamplingConfig(alpha=0.5),
...         curriculum=CurriculumConfig(enabled=True, quality_col="Quality"),
...     ),
...     task_affinity=TaskAffinityConfig(enabled=True, n_groups=2),
...     inter_task_affinity=InterTaskAffinityConfig(enabled=True),
... )

class admet.model.chemprop.EnsembleConfig(data=<factory>, model=<factory>, optimization=<factory>, mlflow=<factory>, joint_sampling=<factory>, task_affinity=<factory>, inter_task_affinity=<factory>, ray=<factory>)[source]Â¶

Bases: object

Complete configuration for ensemble Chemprop training.

This configuration extends the single-model config to support training multiple models across splits and folds with Ray-based parallelization.

Parameters:

  • data (EnsembleDataConfig) â Ensemble data paths and column configuration.

  • model (ModelConfig) â Model architecture configuration (shared across ensemble).

  • optimization (OptimizationConfig) â Training optimization configuration (shared across ensemble).

  • mlflow (MlflowConfig) â MLflow tracking configuration.

  • joint_sampling (JointSamplingConfig) â Unified configuration for task-aware oversampling and curriculum learning. When curriculum is enabled, all ensemble members share the same curriculum schedule for consistent quality-aware sampling.

  • ray (RayConfig) â Ray parallelization configuration for distributed ensemble training.

  • task_affinity (TaskAffinityConfig)

  • inter_task_affinity (InterTaskAffinityConfig)

Examples

>>> from omegaconf import OmegaConf
>>> from admet.model.chemprop.config import EnsembleConfig
>>>
>>> config = OmegaConf.merge(
...     OmegaConf.structured(EnsembleConfig),
...     OmegaConf.load("ensemble_config.yaml")
... )
>>> ensemble = ModelEnsemble.from_config(config)
>>> ensemble.train_all()

  • target_weights (List[float], optional) â Per-task weights for the loss function. If empty, all tasks are weighted equally (1.0 each).

  • output_dir (str, optional) â Directory to save model checkpoints and outputs. If None, uses a temporary directory.

class admet.model.chemprop.ModelConfig(depth=5, message_hidden_dim=600, dropout=0.1, num_layers=2, hidden_dim=600, batch_norm=True, ffn_type='regression', trunk_n_layers=2, trunk_hidden_dim=600, n_experts=4, aggregation='mean')[source]Â¶

Bases: object

Configuration for Chemprop MPNN architecture.

Parameters:

  • depth (int, default=5) â Number of message passing iterations.

  • message_hidden_dim (int, default=600) â Hidden dimension for message passing layer.

  • dropout (float, default=0.1) â Dropout probability in feed-forward networks.

  • num_layers (int, default=2) â Number of feed-forward layers.

  • hidden_dim (int, default=600) â Hidden dimension for feed-forward layers.

  • batch_norm (bool, default=True) â Whether to use batch normalization in MPNN.

  • ffn_type (str, default="regression") â Type of feed-forward network. Options: âregressionâ, âmixture_of_expertsâ, âbranchedâ.

  • trunk_n_layers (int, default=2) â Number of trunk layers for branched FFN.

  • trunk_hidden_dim (int, default=600) â Hidden dimension for trunk layers in branched FFN.

  • n_experts (int, default=4) â Number of experts for mixture of experts FFN.

  • aggregation (str, default="mean") â Aggregation method for message passing. Options: âmeanâ, âsumâ, ânormâ.

class admet.model.chemprop.OptimizationConfig(criterion='MAE', init_lr=0.0001, max_lr=0.001, final_lr=0.0001, warmup_epochs=5, patience=15, max_epochs=150, batch_size=32, num_workers=0, seed=42, progress_bar=False)[source]Â¶

Bases: object

Configuration for training optimization.

Parameters:

  • criterion (str, default="MAE") â Loss function. Options: âMAEâ, âMSEâ, âRMSEâ, âSIDâ, âBCEâ, âCrossEntropyâ, âDirichletâ, âEvidentialâ, âMVEâ, âQuantileâ.

  • init_lr (float, default=1.0e-4) â Initial learning rate.

  • final_lr (float, default=1.0e-4) â Final learning rate at end of training.

  • patience (int, default=15) â Early stopping patience (epochs without improvement).

Bases: object

  • tracking_uri (str, optional) â MLflow tracking server URI. If None, uses default local storage.

  • experiment_name (str, default="chemprop") â MLflow experiment name to log runs under.

  • nested (bool, default=False) â Whether to create a nested run under the parent_run_id.

Curriculum LearningÂ¶

class admet.model.chemprop.curriculum.CurriculumState(qualities=None, patience=3, config=None)[source]Â¶

Bases: object

Simple quality-aware curriculum state.

Phases:

  • warmup: focus on high-quality data

  • expand: include more medium-quality

  • robust: include some low-quality

  • polish: re-focus on high-quality

Parameters:

  • qualities (List[str] | None)

  • patience (int)

  • config (CurriculumPhaseConfig | None)

maybe_advance_phase(epoch)[source]Â¶

Advance to the next phase when patience has passed with no top-quality improvement.

The progression adapts to however many qualities are provided. For 1-quality datasets this will simply do warmup -> polish (return focus to top quality). For 2-quality datasets: warmup -> expand -> polish. For >=3: warmup -> expand -> robust -> polish.

Parameters:

epoch (int)

sampling_probs()[source]Â¶
target_metric_key()[source]Â¶

Return the default metric key monitored by the curriculum.

Returns âval_lossâ by default. This can be overridden via the monitor_metric parameter in CurriculumCallback.

Return type:

str

Parameters:

  • epoch (int)

  • top_loss (float)

Parameters:

Return type:

None

class admet.model.chemprop.curriculum.CurriculumCallback(curr_state, monitor_metric=None, reset_early_stopping_on_phase_change=False, log_per_quality_metrics=True, quality_labels=None)[source]Â¶

Bases: Callback

Update curriculum state based on validation loss metric.

The metric key monitored defaults to âval_lossâ (overall validation loss) but can be overridden via the monitor_metric parameter.

Phase transitions are logged with epoch number and step for tracking curriculum progression during training.

Parameters:

  • curr_state (CurriculumState) â The curriculum state object to update.

  • monitor_metric (str, optional) â Metric key to monitor for phase transitions. Defaults to âval_lossâ.

  • reset_early_stopping_on_phase_change (bool, default=False) â Whether to reset early stopping patience when advancing phases.

  • log_per_quality_metrics (bool, default=True) â Whether to log per-quality validation metrics.

  • quality_labels (List[str], optional) â Quality labels for validation samples. Required for per-quality metrics.

Custom FFN ArchitecturesÂ¶

class admet.model.chemprop.ffn.MixtureOfExpertsRegressionFFN(n_experts=2, n_tasks=1, input_dim=300, hidden_dim=300, n_layers=1, dropout=0.0, activation='relu', gate_hidden_dim=None, gate_n_layers=1, criterion=None, task_weights=None, threshold=None, output_transform=None)[source]Â¶

Bases: Predictor, HyperparametersMixin

Implementation of the Adaptive Mixture of Local Experts [1] model for regression tasks. The works by passing the learned representation from message passing into one âgating networkâ and a configurable number of âexpertsâ. The outputs of the individual experts are multiplied element-wise by the output of the gating network, enabling the overall architecture to âspecializeâ experts in certain types of inputs dynamically during training.

References

[1]

R. A. Jacobs, M. I. Jordan, S. J. Nowlan and G. E. Hinton, âAdaptive Mixtures of Local Expertsâ Neural Computation, vol. 3, no. 1, pp. 79-87, March 1991, doi: 10.1162/neco.1991.3.1.79.

Parameters:

  • n_experts (int)

  • n_tasks (int)

  • input_dim (int)

  • hidden_dim (int)

  • n_layers (int)

  • dropout (float)

  • activation (str | Module)

  • gate_hidden_dim (int | None)

  • gate_n_layers (int)

  • criterion (ChempropMetric)

  • task_weights (Tensor)

  • threshold (float | None)

  • output_transform (UnscaleTransform)

alias = 'regression-moe'Â¶
encode(Z, i)[source]Â¶

Calculate the i-th hidden representation

Parameters:

  • Z (Tensor) â a tensor of shape n x d containing the input data to encode, where d is the input dimensionality.

  • i (int) â

    The stop index of slice of the MLP used to encode the input. That is, use all layers in the MLP up to i (i.e., MLP[:i]). This can be any integer value, and the behavior of this function is dependent on the underlying list slicing behavior. For example:

    • i=0: use a 0-layer MLP (i.e., a no-op)

    • i=1: use only the first block

    • i=-1: use up to the final block

Returns:

a tensor of shape n x h containing the i-th hidden representation, where h is the number of neurons in the i-th hidden layer.

Return type:

Tensor

forward(Z)[source]Â¶

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses. :rtype: Tensor

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

Parameters:

Z (Tensor)

Return type:

Tensor

property input_dim: intÂ¶
n_targets: int = 1Â¶

the number of targets s to predict for each task t

property n_tasks: intÂ¶
property output_dim: intÂ¶

Should be overridden by all subclasses. :rtype: Tensor

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

class admet.model.chemprop.ffn.BranchedFFN(task_groups, *, n_tasks, input_dim=300, hidden_dim=300, n_layers=1, dropout=0.0, activation='relu', trunk_n_layers=0, trunk_hidden_dim=384, trunk_dropout=0.0, trunk_activation='relu', criterion=None, task_weights=None, output_transform=None)[source]Â¶

Bases: Predictor, HyperparametersMixin

Regression Predictor with a shared trunk (optional) followed by multiple independent MLP branches, each responsible for a group of tasks.

Depth indexing for encode(Z, i):

  • i counts blocks across trunk then branches.

  • If i <= trunk_n_layers: returns trunk[:i](Z)

  • Else: returns concat(branch[:i - trunk_n_layers](trunk(Z)) for each branch)

Parameters:

  • task_groups (list[list[int]]) â Partition of global task indices [0..n_tasks-1].

  • n_tasks (int) â Total number of tasks.

  • input_dim (int) â Input (fingerprint) dimensionality.

  • hidden_dim (int | list[int]) â Branch hidden dim (shared or per-branch).

  • n_layers (int | list[int]) â Branch depth (shared or per-branch).

  • dropout (float | list[float]) â Branch dropout (shared or per-branch).

  • activation (str | nn.Module | list[...]) â Branch activation (shared or per-branch).

  • controls (# NEW trunk)

  • trunk_n_layers (int) â Number of shared layers before branching. 0 disables the trunk.

  • trunk_hidden_dim (int) â Hidden size of trunk blocks; also the input dim to branches when trunk_n_layers>0.

  • trunk_dropout (float) â Dropout in trunk blocks.

  • trunk_activation (str | nn.Module) â Activation used in trunk blocks.

  • criterion (ChempropMetric)

  • task_weights (Tensor)

  • output_transform (UnscaleTransform)

alias = 'regression-branched'Â¶
encode(Z, i)[source]Â¶

If i <= trunk_n_layers: returns trunk[:i](Z) Else: runs full trunk, then concatenates branch[:i - trunk_n_layers](trunk(Z))

Return type:

Tensor

Parameters:

  • Z (Tensor)

  • i (int)

Classical ML SubpackageÂ¶

The admet.model.classical subpackage provides wrappers for traditional machine learning models.

Classical machine learning models for ADMET prediction.

This module provides implementations of classical ML models (XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost) that use molecular fingerprints as features.

class admet.model.classical.CatBoostModel(config)[source]

Bases: ClassicalModelBase

CatBoost model for ADMET property prediction.

Uses molecular fingerprints as features and CatBoost gradient boosting for regression. Supports multi-output prediction via MultiOutputRegressor.

Parameters:

config (DictConfig) â Configuration with model.catboost params and fingerprint settings.

Examples

>>> config = OmegaConf.create({
...     "model": {
...         "type": "catboost",
...         "catboost": {
...             "iterations": 100,
...             "depth": 6,
...             "learning_rate": 0.1,
...         },
...         "fingerprint": {"type": "morgan"},
...     },
...     "mlflow": {"enabled": False},
... })
>>> model = CatBoostModel(config)
>>> model.fit(smiles_list, targets)
>>> predictions = model.predict(new_smiles)

config (DictConfig) â Model configuration.

Configured model instance.

CatBoostModel

class admet.model.classical.ClassicalModelBase(config)[source]

Bases: BaseModel, MLflowMixin

Base class for classical ML models with fingerprint features.

Provides common functionality for gradient boosting models (XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost) that operate on molecular fingerprints rather than raw SMILES.

Parameters:

config (DictConfig) â Model configuration with model params, fingerprint settings, and MLflow config.

model_type

Type identifier for the model.

Type:

str

fingerprint_generator

Generator for molecular fingerprints.

Type:

FingerprintGenerator

  • sample_weight (np.ndarray | None) â Optional sample weights.

  • **kwargs (Any) â Additional keyword arguments passed to the estimator.

class admet.model.classical.LightGBMModel(config)[source]

Bases: ClassicalModelBase

LightGBM model for ADMET property prediction.

Uses molecular fingerprints as features and LightGBM gradient boosting for regression. Supports multi-output prediction via MultiOutputRegressor.

Parameters:

config (DictConfig) â Configuration with model.lightgbm params and fingerprint settings.

Examples

>>> config = OmegaConf.create({
...     "model": {
...         "type": "lightgbm",
...         "lightgbm": {
...             "n_estimators": 100,
...             "num_leaves": 31,
...             "learning_rate": 0.1,
...         },
...         "fingerprint": {"type": "morgan"},
...     },
...     "mlflow": {"enabled": False},
... })
>>> model = LightGBMModel(config)
>>> model.fit(smiles_list, targets)
>>> predictions = model.predict(new_smiles)
